organizations: Kurdistan Regional Security Council via AP

thread.title: New video purportedly shows US-Kurdish raid against IS group
thread.title_full: New video purportedly shows US-Kurdish raid against IS group

title: New video purportedly shows US-Kurdish raid against IS group
text: Add a message (optional) Success - Article sent! close This image made from video taken on Thursday, Oct. 22, 2015 from a helmet camera, shows U.S. and Iraqi special forces freeing hostages from a prison controlled by Islamic State militants in the town of Huwija, 15 kilometers (9 miles) west of the Iraqi city of Kirkuk. The Kurdish regional government in northern Iraq released a video Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015 purportedly showing the joint raid of a prison by U.S. and Kurdish peshmerga forces in which they released 70 hostages from the Islamic State groupâs captivity. In the video, a line of panicked men in traditional ankle-length jalabiyas are seen running past the camera, some with their hands up, as Arabic-speaking men scream at them âletâs go! Letâs go!â They are marched through a dark room with the Islamic State groupâs trademark black flag draped over its wall.
